DOC.brief_summary: To determine difference thigh muscle function individual without knee arthritis , also determine effectiveness common physical therapy intervention clinical patient orient outcome .
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective propose research evaluate concurrent change corticospinal excitability central sensitization pain pathway influence quadriceps voluntary activation . A secondary objective establish feasibility intervention study determine change excitability supraspinal motor sensory process modify physical therapy intervention target pain muscle strengthen . We hypothesize patient knee osteoarthritis show measurable deficit quadriceps voluntary activation explain low level corticospinal excitability increase pain sensitization . A 1 week physical therapy intervention improve voluntary activation reduce pain concurrent change underlie motor sensory process . We hypothesize part improvement attribute positive treatment expectation .
DOC.criteria: Age 1965 Grade I II knee Osteoarthritis confirm radiographs imaging least one following : Age > 50 year old Morning stiffness < 30 minute Crepitus Meet least 3 6 diagnostic criterion osteoarthritis : Age > 50 year old Morning stiffness < 30 minute Crepitus Bony tenderness Bony enlargement No palpable warmth BMI > 30 History traumatic spine low extremity injury within last 6 month Previous adverse reaction electrical stimulation ( i.e . burn hypersensitivity ) Cardiac pacemaker Metal implant head Current pregnancy Neurological disorder History seizure Unable give consent understand procedure study
